action.action-desc: Mr. Williams (for himself and Ms. Moore) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to provide that the consumer transaction account deposits of an insured depository institution are not considered to be funds obtained by or through a deposit broker, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Consumer Transaction Account Protection Act of 2017.

section.header: Limited exception for consumer transaction account deposits
section.text: Section 29 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1831f) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Limited exception for consumer transaction account deposits

paragraph.text: Consumer transaction account deposits of an insured depository institution shall not be considered to be funds obtained, directly or indirectly, by or through a deposit broker.

For purposes of this subsection, the term consumer transaction account deposit means a deposit in a transaction account, as defined in section 19(b)(1) of the Federal Reserve Act, with an insured depository institutionâ€”

subparagraph.text: that is entirely covered by deposit insurance;
that is opened by a natural person;
that is held in the name of such natural person;
that is used monthly by such natural person to make payments to, and to receive deposits from, third parties; and
with respect to which only such natural person is recognized by the insured depository institution as being authorized to designate that withdrawals or payments be made from the account.
